column4: does anyone know how to create a backtrace with gdb if the program has *frozen* rather than crashed?
you can use gdb while running the program if it freezes a lot but it's mostly used to look at cores
the program is frozen, but if I kill it, gdb doesn't seem to be able to get any useful information from it
but I don't know how to tell gdb to run a backtrace in its current (frozen) state?
